newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Nedlloyd H1 swollen by extraordinary gain.
newsitem.headline: Nedlloyd H1 swollen by extraordinary gain.

text.p: Transport group Koninklijke Nedlloyd Groep NV on Wednesday announced a first half drop in net profit from ordinary operations but said the overall performance in the half was boosted by a big extraordinary gain.

Shares in the company bounded higher, rising 2.00 guilders to 37.00 guilders in a weaker Amsterdam stock market, boosted by the company's forecast that it did not anticipate a loss from ordinary operations for the year.

"The recovery of results in the ocean shipping sector strengthens the executive board in its confidence that we will not make a loss for the whole of 1996," the company said in a statement with results.
The unpredictability of market developments, especially in container shipping, made it impossible to make a precise forecast of 1996 results, it added.
Net profit from ordinary operations in the six months to June 30 slid to six million guilders from 38 million in the same period a year earlier.

A massive 273 million guilder extraordinary gain arising from the sale of a subsidiary and a 26 million guilder refund from its pension fund boosted total net profit to 276 million guilders from 96 million in the first half of last year.
Nedlloyd said it made a book profit of 247 million guilders on the sale of its offshore drilling unit Neddrill.
Analysts had expected a first half loss before extraordinaries of 15 to 35 million guilders.
